qas.question: How much of Nigeria's population in 2009 was rural?
How much of Nigeria's population in 2009 was urban?
What was Nigeria's population density in 2009?
When did President Goodluck Jonathan advocate limiting childbirth?

context: The United Nations estimates that the population in 2009 was at <a0_0>154,729,000<a0_0/>, distributed as <a1_0>51.7%<a1_0/> rural and <a2_0>48.3%<a2_0/> urban, and with a population density of <a3_0>167.5 people per square kilometre<a3_0/>. National census results in the past few decades have been disputed. The results of the most recent census were released in December 2006 and gave a population of 140,003,542. The only breakdown available was by gender: males numbered 71,709,859, females numbered 68,293,08. On <a4_0>June 2012<a4_0/>, President Goodluck Jonathan said that Nigerians should limit their number of children.
